org.sensorhub.impl.processing

Class AbstractStreamProcess<ConfigType extends StreamProcessConfig>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sensorhub.impl.module.AbstractModule<ConfigType>
      • org.sensorhub.impl.processing.AbstractStreamProcess<ConfigType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ConfigType - Type of process configuration
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventListener, IEventProducer, IDataProducerModule<ConfigType>, IModuleWithDescription, IModule<ConfigType>, IProcessModule<ConfigType>, IStreamProcessModule<ConfigType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SMLStreamProcess

    public abstract class AbstractStreamProcess<ConfigType extends StreamProcessConfig>
extends AbstractModule<ConfigType>
implements IStreamProcessModule<ConfigType>

    Class providing default implementation of common stream processing API methods. This can be used as the base for most stream process implementations.
    Concrete process implementations generally need to override either AbstractModule.init(ModuleConfig) or start() in order to provide actual process inputs, outputs and parameters.

    Since:
    Feb 22, 2015
    Author:
    Alex Robin

      Map<String,net.opengis.swe.v20.DataComponent> getParameters()
      Gets the list of parameters for this process.
      Values should be changed directly inside the objects returned in the map.
      Parameters that can be changed during processing must be marked as 'updatable' and the new set values are taken into account ASAP by the running process.
      Changing the value during processing of parameters that are not updatable is either silently ignored or can result in a processing exception.
      void handleEvent(Event<?> e)

      Pauses processing of the event stream.
      Incoming events are simply discarded and won't be processed when the process is resumed.

      void resume()
      Resumes normal processing of the event stream.
      Processing may actually resume only when the next event is received.
      void start()
      Starts the module with the current configuration.
      init() should always be called before start().
      void stop()
      Stops the module.
      All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
      stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        protected abstract void process(DataEvent lastEvent)
                         throws ProcessException
        Method called everytime a new data event has been received on any input.
        Concrete implementation must override this method to launch processing when appropriate (e.g. when enough data has been received).
        Since data is accumulated in input queues, process should properly remove any data that needs to be discarded from the queues, as early as possible, even when no processing is done.
        Parameters:
        lastEvent - data event triggering this call
        Throws:
        ProcessException

      • addOutput

        protected void addOutput(IStreamingDataInterface outputInterface)
        Helper method to make sure derived classes add outputs consistently in the different maps
        Parameters:
        outputInterface -

      • getInputDescriptors

        public Map<String,net.opengis.swe.v20.DataComponent> getInputDescriptors()
        Description copied from interface: IProcessModule
        Gets the list of inputs needed by this process.
        Note that input data may contain more than the needed input. To confirm that a given input is acceptable, call IProcessModule.isCompatibleDataSource(DataSourceConfig)
        Specified by:
        getInputDescriptors in interface IProcessModule<ConfigType extends StreamProcessConfig>
        Returns:
        map of descriptors of needed inputs

      • getParameters

        public Map<String,net.opengis.swe.v20.DataComponent> getParameters()
        Description copied from interface: IStreamProcessModule
        Gets the list of parameters for this process.
        Values should be changed directly inside the objects returned in the map.
        Parameters that can be changed during processing must be marked as 'updatable' and the new set values are taken into account ASAP by the running process.
        Changing the value during processing of parameters that are not updatable is either silently ignored or can result in a processing exception.
        Specified by:
        getParameters in interface IStreamProcessModule<ConfigType extends StreamProcessConfig>
        Returns:
        map of parameter descriptors

      • getCurrentFeatureOfInterest

        public net.opengis.gml.v32.AbstractFeature getCurrentFeatureOfInterest()
        Description copied from interface: IDataProducerModule
        Retrieves the feature of interest for which this producer is currently generating data.

        In the case of a module generating data from multiple entities (e.g. sensor network), the feature of interest currently observed by a given entity can be retrieved using IMultiSourceDataProducer.getCurrentFeatureOfInterest(String)
        Specified by:
        getCurrentFeatureOfInterest in interface IDataProducerModule<ConfigType extends StreamProcessConfig>
        Returns:
        map of entityID to feature objects

      • getCurrentDescription

        public net.opengis.sensorml.v20.AbstractProcess getCurrentDescription()
        Description copied from interface: IModuleWithDescription
        Retrieves most current SensorML description of the entity whose data is provided by this module. All implementations must return an instance of AbstractProcess with a valid unique identifier.
        In the case of a module generating data from multiple entities (e.g. sensor network), this returns the description of the group as a whole. Descriptions of individual entities within the group are retrived using IMultiSourceDataProducer.getCurrentDescription(String)
        Specified by:
        getCurrentDescription in interface IModuleWithDescription
        Returns:
        AbstractProcess SensorML description of the data producer or null if none is available at the time of the call

      • getLastDescriptionUpdate

        public long getLastDescriptionUpdate()
        Description copied from interface: IModuleWithDescription
        Used to check when SensorML description was last updated. This is useful to avoid requesting the object when it hasn't changed.
        Specified by:
        getLastDescriptionUpdate in interface IModuleWithDescription
        Returns:
        Date/time of last description update as unix time (ms since 1970) or Long.MIN_VALUE if description was never updated.
